headline.main: If Jeff Wells Ran the Academy

docs.snippet: On Sunday at the Oscars, every one will take their place and the Bagger's place, at least to begin the doings, will be behind a hedge on the red carpet. As some of you more persistent followers of the blog must know, the Bagger's won-loss record o...
docs.lead_paragraph: On Sunday at the Oscars, every one will take their place and the Bagger's place, at least to begin the doings, will be behind a hedge on the red carpet. As some of you more persistent followers of the blog must know, the Bagger's won-loss record on the red carpet makes the Cincinnati Bengals look like a dynasty by comparison. It's not that he doesn't try - he really, really does - but it's just that best intentions are frequently overmatched by the circumstance. "How hard can it be?" he can hear people sniggering up their sleeves.
docs.abstract: On Sunday at the Oscars, every one will take their place and the Bagger's place, at least to begin the doings, will be behind a hedge on the red carpet. As some of you more persistent followers of the blog must know, the Bagger's won-loss record on the red carpet makes the Cincinnati Bengals look like a dynasty by comparison.

headline.main: What Would You Ask a Celebrity?

docs.snippet: Audio excerpts from opera recordings that, in 1907, were carefully wrapped in wax and stored in lead and iron containers beneath the Paris Opera, left, with instructions that they should remain undisturbed for 100 years. One hundred years later, t...
docs.lead_paragraph: Audio excerpts from opera recordings that, in 1907, were carefully wrapped in wax and stored in lead and iron containers beneath the Paris Opera, left, with instructions that they should remain undisturbed for 100 years. One hundred years later, the vault was opened, and the containers were exhumed, right. And, after lengthy examination, cleaning and digitizing of the records, EMI, the heir to the Gramophone Company that supplied the recordings in 1907, is reissuing them on three CDs. The collection will be released in France later this month as ''Les Urnes de l'Opéra'' and in the United States in early April with the English subtitle ''Treasures From the Paris Opera Vaults.'' nytimes.com/music

headline.main: Louie Bellson, Dynamic Jazz Drummer, Dies at 84
headline.print_headline: Louie Bellson, Dynamic Jazz Drummer, Dies at 84

docs.snippet: Louie Bellson, a crisp and dazzling drummer who worked with many of the major figures of the swing era and a gracious entertainer who made frequent appearances at the White House and on ''The Tonight Show,'' died on Saturday in Los Angeles.     He...
docs.lead_paragraph: Louie Bellson, a crisp and dazzling drummer who worked with many of the major figures of the swing era and a gracious entertainer who made frequent appearances at the White House and on ''The Tonight Show,'' died on Saturday in Los Angeles. He was 84 and lived in Los Angeles. His death was announced by Remo, the drum company for which he was a vice president. Matt Connors, the company's manager for artist relations, said Mr. Bellson had been recovering from a broken hip since November.

headline.main: Louie Bellson, Dynamic Jazz Drummer, Dies at 84

docs.snippet: Big attractions at Universal Studios Hollywood include a roller coaster built around "The Mummy" and an elaborate "Jurassic Park" raft ride featuring a 50-foot T-Rex. Then there is the theme park's newest thrill: the chance to see the suit Frank L...
docs.lead_paragraph: Big attractions at Universal Studios Hollywood include a roller coaster inspired by "The Mummy" and an elaborate "Jurassic Park" raft ride featuring a 50-foot T-Rex. Then there is the theme park's newest thrill: the chance to see the suit Frank Langella wore in "Frost/Nixon."
docs.abstract: Big attractions at Universal Studios Hollywood include a roller coaster built around "The Mummy" and an elaborate "Jurassic Park" raft ride featuring a 50-foot T-Rex. Then there is the theme park's newest thrill: the chance to see the suit Frank Langella wore in "Frost/Nixon."

headline.main: L.A. Dispatch: Frost/Nixon, the Theme Park Attraction

docs.snippet: What's wrong with this picture? It's six days before the Oscar ceremony, and the cold, soggy people caught on a Web cam at the Mann Grauman's Chinese Theater, a few steps away from the adjoining Kodak Theater, home of the Oscars, look entirely too...
docs.lead_paragraph: What's wrong with this picture? It's six days before the Oscar ceremony, and the cold, soggy people caught on a Web cam at the Mann Grauman's Chinese Theater, a few steps away from the adjoining Kodak Theater, home of the Oscars, look entirely too much like the cold, soggy people you often see here, on a Web cam some thousands of miles away on Times Square.

headline.main: L.A. Dispatch: Look at All the Cold and Soggy People

docs.snippet: The weak showing by the Oscar movies gets even more worrisome when you start adjusting for ticket price inflation - something officials of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences should avoid if they want to keep a game face on for the sho...
docs.lead_paragraph: As the box-office continues to surge - since the beginning of the year, revenue from domestic ticket sales is up almost 23 percent from the same period last year, to roughly $1.5 billion -- the performance of the Oscar-nominated films just looks worse.
docs.abstract: The weak showing by the Oscar movies gets even more worrisome when you start adjusting for ticket price inflation - something officials of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences should avoid if they want to keep a game face on for the show next Sunday.

headline.main: L.A. Dispatch: Oscar Nominees No Match for Jason
